fields.description:
We insert a work mode filter that filters out issues of released versions, but if the project/issues don't have a fixversion field this query will always filter all issues out.

Expected: Do an issue check and don't insert the work mode filter if fixVersion is hidden.
fields.summary: Kanban board creation: If project has hidden the version no issues are shown

fields.description: We need the ability to re-open a completed sprint that was closed accidentally.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to re-open a completed sprint
As a user, I'd like current sprint issues to be ranked higher than backlog issues

fields.description:
I have seen quite a few issues raised in the Atlassian GreenHopper project related to ranking, and I too have found several bugs and odd behaviors with the new Rapid Boards. One of which in particular was particularly relevant to my reason for creating this issue.

Since issues are tracked with a single, global ranking field, odd things happen when multiple teams want to prioritize the same piece of work differently. For example, suppose an issue is created to change a piece of common functionality shared by 2 products. Further, suppose a team independent from either product is doing the actual work. The team doing the work really is the one responsible for organizing, prioritizing and tracking the issue on their backlog. However, for planning purposes it is helpful to include the same DI on each of the products backlogs as well to ensure their releases are on schedule. Similarly, the relative importance of that work will likely be different for each of the three teams with respect to the other work on their backlog. Now suppose one team decides that the priority of this issue has changed - perhaps it is more important now so they send it to the top of their backlog. Because the ranking values are global this action indirectly affects the priority of this DI on the other two teams backlogs as well. Even worse there is no notification that this change has been made. The other two teams are left to their own accord to figure out why issue priorities are magically changing on their backlogs, assuming they notice the changes at all.

This workflow is suggestive that perhaps rank should not be a property of an issue but rather a property associated with an issue *within the context of a particular backlog*. Perhaps the rank could be relative within a filter (for Kanban workflows), or perhaps relative to specific sprints (for Scrum workflows). I suspect such a change would be quite invasive as it strays from the current design pattern for your tool, but I would think that it models more closely the real-world relationship between work items and teams. A piece of work, generally speaking, does not have one universally acceptable level of importance. Its importance is relative to each person tracking the work.

From a brief examination of some of the "ranking" related issues currently existing in your GreenHopper project, there are quite a few people who have tried to introduce "contextual" rankings thus working around this problem (with varying results, many causing more problems that they fix it seems), however these seem like a band-aid solutions attempting to circumvent this rather subtle design problem.

So, to summarize, I created this DI in part to report a bug with the GreenHopper global ranking mechanism however I suspect that this behavior is by design and a more significant implementation change within the tool would be required to address the issue robustly. This is why I created it with an issue type of Story rather than a bug.
fields.summary: Rankings should be per-context rather than global

fields.description:
There is no possibility to change the bg- or color of the swimlanes in a greenhopper board. Like you can see in screenshot the swimlane text color and bgcolor is nearly the same. It is realy hard to read the swimlanes in our daily meeting. 

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/111789/change-color-of-swimlanes-in-a-greenhopper-board
fields.summary: Change swimlane bg- or text color in a board

fields.description:
When entering the planning mode in the agile board in Greenhopper, the current sprint appears collapsed, while the backlog has no option to either collapse/expand. It's always expanded. 

I'm looking for the possibility to collapse the backlog.
fields.summary: Collapsable backlog

fields.description:
If issues are selected:
- Ranked after the last selected issue

If no issues are selected:
- Ranked before the top visible issue, where "visible" means the section of the Backlog visible in the viewport (including upcoming sprints but not the current sprint)
- If the current sprint is taking up the entire viewport, then the top of the backlog/future sprints is used

If multiple issues are created at once:
- Ranked in order of creation (as normal), all issues appear in the appropriate position based on the above rules.

Filtering of any kind (Quick, Instant, Epic) should not impact on where issues are placed - the rules of visibility still apply.

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if the view is stale?
A: We will place the issue according to the currently visible issues, so if they are out of date the issue might appear at the wrong place

Q: What if the viewport is huge or very very small?
A: Same result as if the viewport is normally sized.

Q: What if the detail view is closed/open?
A: doesn't affect the logic

Q: What if multiple issues are selected?
A: We'll place the issue after the last selected issue 

Q: What if an epic is selected?
A: We currently don't have epic selection

Q: What if a quick/instant filter is applied?
A: See first answer, we'll place it before the first visible issue. In case the selected issue is instant filtered, we still place it after the selected issue

Q: What if your last selected issue is the last issue but it was moved/deleted?
A: moved: it will be ranked according to the new location. deleted: bad luck, it will be ranked last

Q: Can you fool GH by setting the URL without loading it and creating at the new selection?
A: no, GH doesn't look at the url, it looks at the internal state (which might come from the url when you hit return in the address bar). Even if it did, this wouldn't be the end of the world.

Q: What if you don't have schedule permission?
A: We'll silently ignore rank errors, so the issue will end up at the end of the backlog

Q: What if the selection is within an active sprint?
A: The issue would be added at the top of the backlog

Answers provided by Michael R and Nikolay
fields.summary: On plan mode rank newly created items immediately below the currently selected item
Experiment with deployment scenarios for DE (e.g. downgrades)

fields.description:
I find the issue details pane on scrum boards pretty difficult to use.

1--I'd like to be able to configure which fields are displayed on the first tab. we don't use fix versions, so that is just taking up space. 

2--The fields in the first tab are not editable -- components, labels, assignee, reporter, etc. it's extra work to modify these things; i have to open the full issue view in a new tab, which is distracting from what I was trying to do: prioritize & edit tasks.

3--There is no way to resolve an issue from the planning board. If an issue is bogus, I have to first go to the full issue view so I can resolve it.

4--the tabbed interface is inefficient. 
      often i have to flip back & forth between the task description, comments, attachments, and subtasks. I think a single tab with collapsible sections would be much easier to use.

5--fields on the first tab take too much space. it shouldn't require 90px of vertical space to show 2 dates or 2 people. I realize there is the issue of how to display things when there are many custom fields, but that shouldn't preclude dense information display for the default/required fields.
fields.summary: scrum board: issue details

fields.description: the classic boards had options to configure the way tasks were displayed. it would be great if that was possible in scrum boards. it would also be great if there was a visual indicator for tasks that are in-progress.
fields.summary: scrum board: configure the way tasks are displayed in Plan mode

fields.description:
Many sites these days let you drag&drop or paste an image into an input field. This would make greenhopper/jira much, much easier to use. my desktop is littered with temp images I've saved just so I can upload them via the filepicker.

For example, github now does this. there are many 3rd party plugins to facilitate, it should be very trivial to implement.
https://github.com/blog/1347-issue-attachments
fields.summary: paste images into description box

fields.description:
When configuring a board, I can choose to "Base Swimlanes" on either Stories or Queries. I'd like to have both types at once: one swimlane for each story (containing their subtasks) and another swimlane for bugs.

To me, the ideal Scrum board would be like this:
- Swimlane 1: Story 1 and its tasks
- Swimlane 2: Story 2 and its tasks
- Swimlane 3: Bugs
- Swimlane 4: Technical debt
fields.summary: Allow creation of separate swimlanes for stories (and their tasks) and bugs

fields.description: Per screenshot, that would be great if the users can have an overview about those issues either by viewing them in the issue navigator or individually.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to get an overview about the issues which the systems alerts the user while starting a sprint

fields.description: Empowering project admins to enable Simplified Workflows opens the door to destructive possibilities.  If the operation could be undone then a global JIRA admin would be able to assist a project admin after an unexpected change.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Global Administrator I would like to undo the action of a project administrator who has enabled SImplified Workflows

fields.description: Please test Simplified Workflows functionality to ensure that it scales for large enterprise customers.  As an Admin I don't want my instance to go down or be slow because an inexperienced project admin does something unexpected.
fields.summary: As an Enterprise GreenHopper user I need to be assured that the act of a project admin enabling Simplified Workflows on a single project containing 200,000 issues will not adversely affect any users of the JIRA instance

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
In certain cases the 'Not started' story points shows wrong number

As an example: the total points should be '9.997' or '10' since it will take two number after decimal point, but it shows as '91.00'
!sprint.JPG|thumbnail!

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Set the 'Estimation Statistic' as 'Story Points'
# Create two issues:
** First issue with story point *'1.667'*
** Second issue with story point *'8.33'*
# Create a sprint for those two issues and start the sprint.
# You will see the 'Not started' story points shows '91.00', which it suppose to be '9.997'/'10'

h4.Diagnose
This is only happen when the third decimal number is >= '5' for the total story points, e.g. '0.665' or '0.667'. If the total story points as *'9.991'*, everything looks normal. 

However, when you start work on issue, let's say move the first issue to 'In Process', then the 'In progress' value will take '1.667' as '1.67' as expected. 
!sprint2.JPG|thumbnail!

h4. Current Workaround
Avoid to use a story points with more than two decimal.
fields.summary: Wrong calculation of the story points in sprint marker

fields.description:
Currently, the ability to use the Ranking field is based on the Scheduling or the Resolve Issues Permissions.
In some cases, an organization need the ability to separate these permissions.
For example:
* I have two group of users, let's say 'groupA' and 'groupB'
* 'groupA' needs to set up the 'Due Date' for tickets ONLY (unable to rank an issue).  Then, they need to have the 'Schedule issues' permission.
* 'groupB' can Rank issues ONLY(unable to set a 'Due Date').  They also need to have the 'Schedule issues' permission.
* The problem is that when both of them have the 'Schedule issues' permission, they will be able to Rank the issues and also set the 'Due Date' at the same time.

Having an additional "Rank issue Permission" would cover the need.
fields.summary: Specific permission to "Rank issue"

fields.description:
As a Rapid Board User,  it will be more convenience to have more shortcuts for the issue view detail, as shown:
!shortcut.JPG|thumbnail!

There are already have the 't' for issue detail and 'm' for comment, It will be great if we can add the 'd' for description; 'a then t' for attachment; 'c then s' for create sub-task maybe.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board User it will be great to have more shortcuts for the issue view detail

fields.description:
When user have a lot of issues in the 'Backlog' and multiple 'Sprints' , it's difficult to drag and drop them to a 'sprint' that you want. As a current workaround that we can use the 'send to top' option, but it will always deliver the issues to the top inactive Sprint instead of the Backlog itself. 

In this case, it will be grate to have a 'Sprint' box works like the 'Epic' box which allow user to drag and drop issues on the side of the board and when you scroll down the page, the 'Sprint' box will be following as the 'Epic' box, then we can easier to drag issues inside. 

To understand it better, here is a basic idea design on this:
!epic2.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'Sprint' box should works like the 'Epic' box which allow user to drag and drop issues on the side

fields.description:
Due to a typo, our rapid board is now owned by a user who cannot see the rapid board.  The original owner who changed the ownership to the wrong user cannot undo their change.  The new owner cannot undo the change because they cannot see the rapidboard.

I admit there might be some circumstances where one might want to set up rapid boards for users who can't see them _yet_ or something, but I think that's probably an edgecase.
fields.summary: Rapid board owners can be set to users who cannot see the board

fields.description:
Markup is a form but since it will not be edited update markup.
The form overrides to work in the epic break in ADG reskin so this work avoids those issues too.
fields.summary: Change epic expanded info to different markup structure - sidestep ADG changes to form markup
Improve sprint filtering REST test coverage

fields.description: If adding the Epic Colour field to the columns on the issue navigator, the colour code in HEX is displayed instead of the actual colour. It should be displayed the actual colour or it shouldn't be possible to add this field as a column on the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Epic Colour is displayed the Issue Navigator as HEX instead of the actual colour

fields.description:
Currently, if a user would like to add an issue to a current sprint, he may do so by:
# Create a new issue. Once created, this issue should be on the backlog
# You can drag the newly created issue into the Sprint

However, it would be convenient if there is a configuration whereby creating a new issue is automatically placed on the current active sprint
fields.summary: Automatically add a newly created issue into an active sprint

fields.description:
At the moment, the quick view on the new board consists of Details, Details, Comments, Attachment, and Subtask.  It would be great to have a configuration to add additional tab with a customize layout (fields). 

!tab.png!
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to customize the Quick View on the new board

fields.description: A customer's scenario has the Sprint name to be the same as the Fix Version.  For example, the fix version is 1.0 and a user creates a sprint name "1.0".  When a user drags an issue to the Sprint 1.0, the fix version will automatically change to 1.0.
fields.summary: Synchronize the fix version with the Sprint Name

fields.description: In plan mode when no epics are yet created and the epic panel is expanded, a lot of screen realestate is wasted. We can show a how-to informing the planner that no epics are yet created and how he can do so. Maybe even a small text on how to use epics similar to the info around planning mode that is shown when no issue is yet selected.
fields.summary: As a planner in a project with no epics defined, I'd like to see a how-to for epics

fields.description: Timebox [1] day
fields.summary: Spike: Right click menus on cards in backlog

fields.description:
The user would like to change the *Default Sprint Duration* (for the *Scrum* Rapid board) from {{14}} to {{7}} days. Please refer to the screenshot.

Is it possible to implement the feature to have the ability to *configure* this? Perhaps on project level rather than Global JIRA projects?

!sprint_duration.JPG!
fields.summary: Configure default Sprint Duration on project level

fields.description: As of now, *GreenHopper* only allows a single owner for a particular *Rapid Board*. Are there any plans to have the ability to have multiple owners for a single board?
fields.summary: Multiple owner of Rapid Boards

fields.description: Requested by a few third party developers working on plugins3
fields.summary: As a Connect plugin developer, I want to provide a panel in JIRA Agile's Issue Detail View

fields.description:
The new Greenhopper Rapid Board uses the 'Epic Link' field to relate a story to an Epic.

However, I like to directly edit the Epic while I am viewing a story in JIRA or edit it later on. Even I have add the 'Epic Link' to the create/edit issue screen. (As some users do not always edit stories in GH Rapid board only). Therefore It will be great if we can set or edit the Epic Link in the issue view page in JIRA.

At the same time, in the 'issue detail view' of Greenhopper Rapid board. You can delete the entry of the 'Epic Link' field in the detail view but cannot edit it, and you always have to go through drag and drop to the Epic.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the 'Epic Link' when creating or editing issue from issue view in JIRA

fields.description:
Why it is not possibility to have one permission to rank the issues in greenhooper? 

Sometimes the product owner takes care of the ranking but don't take care about due dates, because due dates can be also for subtasks and an agreement between the scrum team and an external. But as a product owner i don't want that the scrum team reranking the issues.
fields.summary: Unbind the ranking permisson from schedule or resolving

fields.description:
I would like to define a structure in my sprints, for instance to groupe them into a one or several releases.
And then I would ne able to see a burndown of sprint / release or project
This was available in the Classic GH, and is missing in the new version
fields.summary: As a User I would like to group sprints into a release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6850].
  {panel}

A project admin user moves an issue from Project A to Project B when still associated with Rapid Board A.  The issue is added to the Project B rapid board.

Later a user in either Project A or Project B attempt to close their respective sprints in Project A or Project B rapid board.  They are each greeted with an error:

Error
To update this sprint you must have Project Administrator permissions for all of the following projects: Project A, Project B.

It would be better if the move did not result in a requirement for an admin in both projects to close the sprint.

Also reported here in Confluence Docs:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ending+a+Sprint?focusedCommentId=330795683#comment-330795683

This is really confusing to users because you can't remove the sprint from the moved issue unless that issue exists in some other board.

UPDATE: This also affects the ability to start sprint.

h3. Workarounds
* Do a *[Bulk Edit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Modifying+Multiple+(Bulk)+Issues#ModifyingMultiple(Bulk)Issues-PerformingaBulkOperation]* on the moved issues to remove the value for the "Sprint" from those issues;
OR
* Add the "Sprint" field to the *Edit* screens associated with the issue types for that project you moved issues to and edit the issues and remove the value for the "Sprint" field;
fields.summary: Moving issue from project in rapid board to another project results in inability to close or start sprint for non admin

fields.description:
Consolidate properties file with the agile2012 replacements
Remove redundant code - only non Rapid names will be served
fields.summary: Remove redundant code from Rapid Board terminology change
Improve REST test coverage of sprint CRUD functionality

fields.description: In order to manage our backlog, which can be quite large, we will create several Sprints on the Plan board and add items periodically as customer requirements get prioritized. Currently, only the active Sprint has the ability to be collapsed. It would be very handy to be able to collapse any Sprint that exists on the Plan board and then drag and drop tickets onto the collapsed Sprint of interest.
fields.summary: Collapse 1 or more sprints on the Plan board

fields.description: I would like the ability to control click the tickets in the backlog to either drag or perhaps right click for a context menu to do things like move into existing sprint. This would allow users to perform actions on multiple tickets at one time.
fields.summary: Add controls to backlog view for better management

fields.description:
A sprint cannot be created with a time less than 'NOW'. We have several teams that sync the sprint dates but we don't create our sprints at exactly the same time. Allowing more flexible time handling when creating sprints would make coordination between teams much simpler.

*Workaround*

Edit the start date after creation. By doing this, you acknowledge that this will be listed as scope change within the sprint. The alternative is to backdate the Change History on the added issues.
fields.summary: Sprint creation times

fields.description: In past JIRA versions, we could drag tickets from the 'To Do' column into the 'In Progress' column and JIRA would update the assigned user to whomever did the dragging. That capability is not part of the new JIRA which increases the time it takes to manage tasks. In general, tasks may not always be assigned to the person who will be fixing it so allowing anyone to grab and drag tickets is essential.
fields.summary: Unable to move tickets from the Work board from 'To Do' to 'In Progress' without changing the user

fields.description: When a ticket is clicked in the plan board, the preview panel on the right appears. If I then want to edit the ticket, I have to click yet again and open it for edit. Why not make the preview not only editable but configurable so that I can pick what gets displayed for each tab, ie 'Details', 'Description', etc. I think this would save time and be much more intuitive.
fields.summary: Make the ticket preview panel in the plan board more usable

fields.description:
GreenHopper provides a dialog off the welcome mat in order to create a project within JIRA.

The AddProject.jspa action has a src parameter which can be used to distinguish different ways of getting into AddProject in analytics. 

As a good JIRA analytics citizen, and to determine how many people create projects via GH vs. other methods, GH needs to add a "src" query param to each of it's usages of AddProject.
fields.summary: Raise analytics events for GreenHopper usage of AddProject

fields.description:
As a JIRA Admin, I want to be able to use some custom status field as a base for columns separation. The system status field is used for all development tickets (Open, In Progress, In QA, Complete, etc).

Meanwhile, Epics have an additional set of statuses as they represent a Release (Piepelined, Approved, In Ideation, In Execution, Under Review, Closed). So I would like to be able to create a Release Board with columns based on those custom statuses.
fields.summary: Ability to map custom field to columns on the board

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Log in to JIRA and try to create an issue. The JIRA create issue form is displayed. !create_issue_jira.png!

- Now, go to ({{_Agile > Classic >_}}). Click  "Tools" and then "Configure". Disable the option *Card Creation*, to force creation of issues via JIRA.

- Click on the *Create Issue* button in JIRA. Greenhopper create card form is displayed !create_issue_gh.png!
fields.summary: 'Create Issue' button on Classic boards launches the Greenhopper form instead of the JIRA form even with Card Creation disabled
Investigate TPM Build failure
Investigate performance of jQuery UI sortable

fields.description:
COS: 
- Wiki markup would be preferable 
- Some way to get at them and edit them from Plan, Work and Report modes
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to attach notes to my Sprint that I can see from plan, work and report mode to provide descriptive information

fields.description:
COS:
- manually triggered for a whole project
- show the number of issues to be updated before you hit go
- make it clear that this only migrates data that exists right now - it does not synchronise the relationships over time. also make it clear that it can be re-run at a later time if necessary.
- put in the global config in a new tab -- *Classic Epic Migration*
- explain what is about to happen when they proceed:
-- find issues with an issue key in the 'Epic / Theme' field then convert this to an Epic link. If a story is already linked with Epic Link field, ignore it.
-- server-side logging
- notify the Admin on confirmation page they should remove the Epic / Theme field (if it is no longer being used)
- modify description of Epic/Theme custom field so that it references Classic Boards

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Need to try with data from epics still in labs
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens when editing the old epic links?
A: (/) The old epic links can be updated but are not synced to the new style of epic link. Another migration is needed to port over the updated classic epic link (this will only work if the target issue has not yet been linked to a new style epic link)

Q: If you update classic epic links, will new ones be created as well from now on?
A: (/) No, there is no synchronization between old and new epic links

Q: What if there is old epic label data from when epics was still in labs (aka field is named something else)?
A: (/) Upgrade tasks will have migrated it. The migration uses the configuration of classic mode to find the classic epic link custom field

Q: Are there any differences with JIRA/AO versions we need to be wary of?
A: (/) Nope
fields.summary: As a Classic user I would like my epic-issue relationships migrated for use on the new boards

fields.description: I was looking at using Epics to help track like tickets the problem is that if a story is added to a sprint and the sprint is completed, the ticket no longer shows on the planning board.   So the only way to find the associated epic ticket is to write a JQL.
fields.summary: link Epics and stories in the tickets

fields.description: Have the ability to have Sub-Task included in a sprint without having its parent and siblings included in a sprint.
fields.summary: Sub-Task in a sprint

fields.description: As a user of the Rapid Board  iwould like to have gridlines for the reports/charts that are like the Chart board.
fields.summary: Gridlines for Rapid Board

fields.description:
I have added three issues to my backlog (we do this by assigning a sprint team) in this order:

# CORE-1826
# CORE-1825
# CORE-1824

In the backlog these items appear in the wrong order:

# CORE-1824
# CORE-1825
# CORE-1826

I believe this is because the CORE-1824 ticket has been created at first and therefore has a lower value for the global rank field.

This would cause even more confusion if you add really old tickets to the backlog that have a way lower global rank and would appear within already prioritized items.
fields.summary: As a sprint manager I want issues that I add to the backlog to append at the end of it

fields.description:
We have had a lot of issues setting up the Scrum board so any tasks will show on the backlog (plan view). There seems to be a set up requirements you need on the tasks and project setup before anything will appear. Our problem was with the Sprint custom field was not applied for the project. Basically there should be better in app help to detect issues and help you fix them

* Anything required that would prevent an issue showing should be detected if possible and either have an option to fix it or instructions to fix

other related problem we found 
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/79301/why-are-bug-issues-not-visible-in-greenhopper-scrum-board-plan-view
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43735/issues-not-showing-up-in-plan-view-of-rapid-board
fields.summary: Better setup assistance for Scrum Boards

fields.description:
When hovering over an Issue Link, rather than seeing just:

View this issue in Jira: XX-NNNN

You should see

Jira: XX-NNNN 'Summary text'

IF this was implemented across the board then many of the reports will be instantly more useful as you then don't have to navigate to different pages to see what ID XX-NNNN refers to. 

A task ID on its own is much less useful in Agile development than it is in the Support environment. In Support the ID is often used as the basis for referring to a customer problem or ticket.

However, in Agile, the story summary is the main thing and IDs are more incidental.
fields.summary: Hover over Issue Link to show Issue Summary

fields.description:
Customer would like description field to automatically resize editing window so user does not have to resize - 

"I believe that this behavior is incorrect. The editing mode of this field should size itself vertically so that as much of the description text/markup is visible without forcing the user to grab the edit box thumb (lower right) and drag it down. There's no reason for this extra step in my opinion."
fields.summary: Auto resize of details card to match size of description field

fields.description: This doesn't fix the problem where the cancel button is triggered when you change the colour i.e. if you're editing an existing JQL query and change the colour, any other changes will be lost. This needs an additional fix like creating a specific behaviour for the JQL row, however it also needs more thought, to make sure the updates all happen at once for JQL rows and that you can't click on a colour picker on a non-active row. Seems lower priority though.
fields.summary: Changing color in Queries card color strategy submits edited row immediately

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to remove issue from a sprint is click on the issue and Remove it by click on 'Actions', as shown:
!remove.JPG|thumbnail!

However, it's kind of not intuitive and hard to use or discover.

It will be great if we can drag and drop it just like the actions when add/drag issues inside the sprint.
fields.summary: Drag and drop feature to remove issue from Sprint

fields.description:
Its possible to change the color of the add row, but when changing that color it tries to save the change -> Not Found error shows up.

Also when jql strategy is used the color should only be updated on a click on the Update button, not directly when changing the color!
fields.summary: Editing add row card color results in Not Found error

fields.description: I'd like to add something that would allow me to say a few things about the board to people I share the  board with.  Not sure if I want a banner that shows up for first time users until you dismiss it, or a lil (i) that you could click any time if ya wanted.
fields.summary: As a User, I want to add a description to a Rapid Board so my users know how its set up and will stop bugging me all the time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6791].
  {panel}

Here is the step to reproduce the issue: 
# Go to the field configuration and put the "Description" field to hidden.
# Create a Scrum board for the project 
# Click on any issue on the work / plan board the javascript error will appear like in the screenshot in the attachment file.
fields.summary: Scrum board throwing Javascript error when the "description" field of the issue is hidden

fields.description:
This is comparable to project templates in GreenHopper Classic.

The creater of a new Rapid Board does not have to care about correct column / status mapping and (color) visualization, but can simply rely on one or more named templates predefined by a JIRA system admin. that saves time and avoids errors.

I see, that today you can kind of bypass this problem by using the COPY function. but this has the same disadvantages as e.g. copying normal PowerPoint files over and over again by various persons, without knowing which is the most relevant / error free one. and the alltime risk, that you copy "crap". having a central QA'd template is much more robust.

It would also be good to be able to change the template for a Rapid Board after its creation.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I would like to use a predefined template for my Agile Board

fields.description:
Lately, JIRA users are confronted with this message:

"The Classic boards are no longer being actively improved and are not recommended for use in new projects. Learn more about Getting Started with the new boards."

This is very irritating for our users, especially as they do not understand, what THEY should concretely do differently. when you have 2,000 users this is a real cost factor / waste.

please remove the message.
fields.summary: Please remove message "The Classic boards are no longer being actively improved ..."

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6788].
{panel}
h3. _To replicate_

_Set up the environment as follows:_
 # Should be in a classic project (sprint-enabled) 
 # Workflow can be simple: Todo → In Progress → Done. (Best to edit a new workflow then [activate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/managing-your-workflows-861253558.html] it)
 # Whilst creating the "In Progress" → "Done" transition in this workflow, assign a screen to it. (The screen can be pre-existing).
 ## Modify this screen: add the "Log Work" field.
 # In this "In Progress" → "Done" transition, add a new *[post-function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-postfunctions]*: "Update Issue Field" - setting "Remaining Estimate" to {{0}}. Publish the workflow with these changes.

 * (Current incorrect behaviour: If the post-function is the first in the list, then "Remaining Values" won't be updated and "Time Spent" will.)
 * (Current incorrect behaviour: If the post-function is the last in the list, then "Time Spent" won't be updated and "Remaining Values" will.)

_Then, perform the following actions:_
 # Add a new issue to the sprint, of an issue type that the screen is assigned to.
 # Set the *Original Estimate* of this issue to {{8h}}
 # On the board, drop this issue into the Done column following the workflow, the screen should appear. In the screen modal:
 ## Log in {{4h}} work into *Time Spent*
 ## "Adjust automatically" should be checked for *Remaining Estimate*
 # On transition completion, the post-function from the workflow should then automatically set the *Remaining Estimate* to {{0h}}

 * *Greenhopper* does not understand that the *Remaining Estimate* had been decreased first by {{4h}} and then by {{4h}} again.

If the *post-function* of _Update Issue Field_ is not used, the issue does not occur. Considering the *post-function* ships with the out-of-the-box, *JIRA*, it should take into consideration of setting the *Remaining Estimate* to {{0}}.
fields.summary: The Burndown Chart does not consider JIRA post function when calculating Remaining Estimate

fields.description:
When clicking between the 2 epics with zero issues no change is noted and so subsequently the epic cannot be deselected (unless an epic which does register a change is clicked).
[~miruflin] noted the issue was introduced at https://bitbucket.org/greenhopper/greenhopper/changeset/7e11f95cf1f7e5d8f6c0a9766c90c77090c1194a

cc [~igrunert]
fields.summary: Clicking between 2 epics with zero issues breaks epic filtering

fields.description:
If I search for specific issues on the Issue Navigator (specify project and label) and go to _Views > Charts_ and select one of this gadgets:

- GreenHopper Classic Cumulative Flow Chart
- GreenHopper Classic Hour Burndown Chart
- GreenHopper Classic Statistics Burndown Chart

It's not displaying those issues on the chart, it displays all issues from the project.
fields.summary: GreenHopper Classic Charts don't respect the filter

fields.description:

* Any swimlane or quick filter event where the "old" JQL is blank
* Rapid Board copy
* Move Marker -- delete
* Control F on Planning Board
* Sprint Issue Add -- tries to use an array as 'action', not sure what we're trying to do here

Could be more as well.
fields.summary: Analytics events without 'action' are not firing

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Create a new board
# Select any project
# Renamed the project's name that is associated with the board
# The process will resulted in an empty backlogs

This is due to a renamed project.  Perhaps the generated filter query can use the project's key rather than the project's name

!renamed.png!
fields.summary: Use the Project Key Rather Than the Project Name on the Board's Filter Query

fields.description:
We create a lot of stories and subdivide each story into tasks. Estimates are made on the tasks.

Because of this, all stories appear to be unestimated, even though we have much better estimates when you take the aggregate of the subtasks.

Should GH be taking this into account?
fields.summary: Epics do not take into account the fact that we have subtasks

fields.description: Total story points or time estimate in Rapid Board columns would be good to have.
fields.summary: Total story points or time estimate in Rapid Board columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6754].
  {panel}

From docens of requests and comments concerning Rapid Board deficiencies on this web site - and from various discussions with other JIRA stakeholders and other customers, I know that this is a very serious issue.

The Rapid Board has moved out of labs way to early for many customers.

This request is meant to gather the MUST HAVE requirements that would make us customers wanting to move to the Rapid Board.

Dear Atlassian, please see this request as a chance to make Rapid Board a really big success. This request is an offer to give our best support to achieve that common goal.

Thank you.
fields.summary: As an Atlassian (enterprise) customer I request that Rapid Board fulfills some MUST HAVE requirements

fields.description:
As the RapidBoard is still so immature for our big organization we cannot start using it.

In order do not confuse our 2,000 users - and for a later migration - we need this little config switch on system level. confusing users means wasting time and money!

PLEASE DO NOT CLOSE THIS REQUEST (as you did for others before)

Please be fair and give other customers the chance to vote on this request as well.

Thank you.
fields.summary: As a JIRA system admin I want to decide, if my users see GreenHopper Classic, RapidBoard or both in the JIRA UI

fields.description:
Hello.

Since I miss the impediment flag functionality in the classic boards I thought of something. I know that it has been suggester to use card colours to highlight impediments, but there are two problems with this. First, colourblind have trouble with card colours, obviously, but secondly, colours are not combinable, but icons are.

I use card colouring to highlight many things, but I must consider the order of the colours.

But by being able to add icons, based on JQL, to the cards in all views would be very useful indeed. Of course it could become quite messy and cluttered if not used wisely, but that should be the decision of the administrators anyway.

Anyone who thinks this is a good Idea but me?
fields.summary: Feature Request: As a Greenhopper user, I'd like be able to add icons to the cards via JQL

fields.description:
Done or 'Done'?

Remove quotes.
fields.summary: Inconsistent use of the term Done

fields.description:
I added ORI-22 twice to ORI-21. ORI-22 correctly shows a change history from null -> ORI-21 and ORI-21 -> ORI-21.

The epic child history on the other hand shows null -> ORI-22, null -> ORI-22 and ORI-22 -> null
fields.summary: Adding an issue twice to an epic creates incorrect Epic Child history (2 adds followed by a remove)

fields.description: The issues show the epic name, but typing the name in instant filter doesn't filter according to that name.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to use instant filter to search issues according to an epic label

fields.description:
When adding an issue to an epic through drag and drop a message is shown that states :

"Selection successfully added to the epic"

When deleting the associated epic in an issue's detail panel, this message is shown :

"Epic successfully removed from selection"

Shouldn't it be : "Selection successfull removed from the epic"?
fields.summary: Opinion: Strangely formulated success message when removing an epic from an issue's detail page
Epic Name is not required because GDOG data was already in Labs
After closing details view on plan mode, clicking on issue will not re-open detail view

fields.description:
JIRA dialogs, suchs a create and edit issue, add comment, etc. all modify the title of the page.

Should we do something similar? How much effort would this take?
fields.summary: Evaluate how JIRA Dialogs influence the page title
